*** Bug 92954 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug 92954 is a dupe of this.

copying info from that bug here;


While using the XSD editor to review several large schemas, the entire 
workbench abruptly crashed, leaving the following trace in the log.  I'm using 
the 19 April I-build.

I logged the bug against SSE because that appears to be the last WST component 
in the stack trace, but may be caused by xsd.ui.  It appears that a component 
is not properly reusing Image instances.

----

I also saw this comment in the code =)

    // TODO... clean this awful code up... we seem to be leaking here too
    // we can't call this directly since the methods are OS dependant
    // fontData.data.lfUnderline = 1
    // so instead we use reflection

            Object data = fontData.getClass().getField("data").get(fontData);
//            System.out.println("data" + data.getClass());
            data.getClass().getField("lfUnderline").setByte(data, (byte)1);
            Font font = new Font(Display.getCurrent(), fontData);
            label.setFont(font);

So this is the obvious place to start.
Need to analyze what the code is really doing before I can propose a fix.
Just noting the more specific problem here.
Keith, thanks for looking into this.

There is now a JUnit testcase that can reproduce this problem. See

dev.eclipse.org
/home/webtools
wst/components/xsd/tests/org.eclipse.wst.xsd.tests.performance
org.eclipse.wst.xsd.tests.performance.OpenEditorOAGISXSDTestcase

You need the OAGIS schemas to run this test, let me know if you want to get 
them.
Fix should be in the latest build
